definition: lit. the old horse loves his stable/fig. sb old but reluctant to relinquish their post (idiom)

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to feel attached to/to long for/to love
a wooden or bamboo pen for sheep or cattle/wood or bamboo trestlework/a warehouse
old horse sniffs the wind (idiom); fig. aged person with great aspirations
old age/eighties, nineties, or greater (of age)
to call sth a cow or a horse (idiom); it doesn't matter what you call it/Insult me if you want, I don't care what you call me.
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
clay ox, wooden horse (idiom); shape without substance/worthless object
poor but ambitious (idiom); hard-pressed but determined/the worse one's position, the harder one must fight back
worn out in body and soul (idiom)
fine horse/thoroughbred
precarious as the morning dew (idiom); fig. ephemeral and precarious nature of human existence
see 只爭朝夕|只争朝夕[zhi3 zheng1 zhao1 xi1]
to correct in the evening a fault of the morning (idiom)/to quickly amend one's ways
river of literacy, sea of learning (idiom); ars longa, vita brevis
lit. ask passers-by how to build one's house (idiom); fig. to have no idea what to do/without a clue
to help each other out in hard times (idiom)
to be full of vigor (idiom)
Sima Xiangru is meticulous and Mei Gao is fast (idiom)/to each his good points
